db:article.db:para: Handles various common platform-specific tasks associated with a Qt project.

db:note.db:para: This command is in technology preview and may change in future releases.

db:article.db:para: The command is defined in the Core component of the Qt6 package, which can be loaded like so:
This command was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: Synopsis
db:section.db:para: If versionless commands are disabled, use qt6_finalize_project() instead. It supports the same set of arguments as this command.

db:section.db:title: Description
db:section.db:para: Some targets that are created using Qt commands require additional actions at the end of CMake configuring phase. Depending on the platform, the function typically:
With CMake version 3.19 or later, you don't need to call this command since it consists of sub-commands that are ordinarily invoked at the end of CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR directory scope processing.

db:warning.db:para: If your Android project is built using a CMake version lower than 3.19, make sure that you call qt6_finalize_project() at the end of a top-level CMakeLists.txt.

db:section.db:title: Examples
db:section.db:para: For projects that use a CMake version lower than 3.19, you need to call qt_finalize_project manually. This example shows the typical use of the function:
db:section.db:programlisting:
cmake_minimum_required(VERSIONS 3.16)
project(MyProject LANGUAGES CXX)
find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS Core)
qt_add_executable(MyApp main.cpp) add_subdirectory(mylib)
qt_finalize_project()
